    • Field Detail

      • DIGEST_ALGORITHM

        public static final String DIGEST_ALGORITHM
        Public key fingerprint digest algorithm. Matching blacklists created by debian: https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/openssl-blacklist/ https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/openssh-blacklist https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/openvpn-blacklist/ The blacklists contains the SHA1 hash with the first 20 bytes remove, i.e. the last 20 bytes
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getFingerprint

        public String getFingerprint()
        Gets the fingerprint. Fingerprint of the key to compare, this is not just a normal fingerprint over the DER encoding For RSA keys this is the hash (see DIGEST_ALGORITHM) over the binary bytes of the public key modulus. This because blacklist is typically due to weak random number generator (Debian weak keys) and we then want to capture all keys generated by this, so we don't want to include the chosen e, only the randomly generated n. For other keys (ECDSA and DSA) it's a fingerprint over the public key encoding.
        Returns:
        fingerprint

      • setFingerprint

        public void setFingerprint​(String fingerprint)
        Sets the fingerprint Fingerprint of the key to compare, this is not just a normal fingerprint over the DER encoding For RSA keys this is the hash (see DIGEST_ALGORITHM) over the binary bytes of the public key modulus. This because blacklist is typically due to weak random number generator (Debian weak keys) and we then want to capture all keys generated by this, so we don't want to include the chosen e, only the randomly generated n. For other keys (ECDSA and DSA) it's a fingerprint over the public key encoding.
        Parameters:
        fingerprint - FP

      • setFingerprint

        public void setFingerprint​(PublicKey publicKey)
        Sets the fingerprint in the correct format from a public key object see setFingerprint(String)
        Parameters:
        publicKey - an RSA public key

      • createFingerprint

        public static String createFingerprint​(PublicKey pk)
        Creates the fingerprint in the correct format from a public key object see setFingerprint(String)
        Parameters:
        pk - a public key, can be RSA, ECDSA or DSA
        Returns:
        public key fingerprint, as required by Blacklist, or null of no fingerprint can be created (due to unhandled key type for example)

      • getPublicKey

        public PublicKey getPublicKey()
        Gets the public key, have to be set transient with setPublicKey(PublicKey), not available after serialization or storage.
        Returns:
        the public key.

      • setPublicKey

        public void setPublicKey​(PublicKey publicKey)
        Sets the transient public key, see getPublicKey()
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the public key.
